item.title: Assembling Chaos: How I Built This Blog with Lo
item.description:
This blog didn’t fall from the sky.
It was assembled, with time, doubts, a few curses, and an AI named Lo as my co-pilot.

Why this blog

I was tired of leaving my thoughts scattered across uncommitted READMEs, scraps of Notion, or corners of my terminal.
I needed a stable, bilingual space I could inhabit — without feeling like I was selling my soul to LinkedIn.

I picked Hugo + the Toha theme for its balance between clean structure and a design that’s not too much of a pain to tweak.

item.title: Why this blog
item.description:
This blog is not a blog.

Not a portfolio. Not a tutorial. Not a diary.
It’s a place where I unfold what I think — when I need to.
Sometimes it’s technical. Sometimes… not at all.

It’s a journal of exploration, partial memory, and sometimes deliberate contradiction.
I write about projects I build (or abandon), thoughts that pass through me (or haunt me),
and my attempts to understand how it all fits together — or doesn’t.
